accsc.detail-desc: Click on an account to view more details!
accsc.ledger-confirming-account: Confirming account address on Ledger device...
accsc.ledger-error-account-denied: Account address denied on Ledger - if it is wrong do not use the wallet!
accsc.warning-index-already-loaded: The account at this index is already loaded
accsc.warning-invalid-index: Invalid account index - must be positive number
accsc.warning-need-min-two-accs: You need at least 2 accounts to sort them
accsc.warning-too-many-accounts: You can only track up to 20 accounts at a time.

no-acc.text1: You don't have any accounts yet,

accdetc.error-rep-change: Error changing representative, please try again
accdetc.label-placeholder: Account Label (Set to blank to delete)
accdetc.title: Account Details
accdetc.warning-account-id: Account ID is not a valid account

addrbookc.desc: You can use the address book to store a label for your own accounts and others you frequently transact with, which are visible throughout the application.
addrbookc.msg-no-addr: You do not have any address book entries saved yet
addrbookc.name: Name
addrbookc.name-hint: Exchange Deposit Address, Main Trading Account, etc
addrbookc.title: Address Book

appc.connecting: Attempting to connect to Mikron node
appc.connect-unable: Unable to connect to Mikron node.  Your balances may be wrong!
appc.error-search-invalid: Invalid Mikron account or transaction hash!
appc.wallet-locked-inactivity: Wallet automatically locked after a period of inactivity

block-service.info-wait-confirm: Waiting for confirmation on Ledger Device...

advanced.all-desc: This will delete ALL stored data, including your wallet, address book, settings and more.
advanced.data-desc: This will delete all data related to your wallet (Your seed and accounts)
advanced.title: Advanced Options
advanced.work-desc: This will delete all locally cached Proof of Work values

display.denom-desc: Change the default denomination used throughout the application when displaying Mikron balances
display.fiat-desc: Change the currency pair used when showing fiat values in the application.  Select None to hide fiat pairs.
display.title: Display Settings

server.conf-desc: Change which server is used to communicate with the Mikron network.  Not recommended to change, only by developers.
server.title: Server Settings

node.desc: Override which node is used by the API Server to communicate with the Mikron network.
node.msg1: This server must be exposing the
node.msg3: to the API server used above.  Requests will still be sent to the API server, but this node will be used to communicate with the network.
node.name: Override Mikron Node

server.desc: This server is used to load, cache, and enhance results from the Mikron node.
server.msg1: This server must be running the
server.msg3: application, or an API compliant with it.
server.name: API Server

updates.desc: This server is used to notify the wallet in real time when new transactions arrive.
updates.msg1: This server must be running the
updates.msg3: application, or a WebSocket API compliant with it.  Note: Since this server only notifies about new transactions, most of the wallet functions fine without it.
updates.name: Updates Server

wallet.lock-desc: Change if your wallet should be locked automatically after you have not interacted with it for a certain period of time
wallet.pow-desc: Change how Proof of Work for your blocks are generated.
wallet.store-desc: Change where your wallet is stored.  If you select none, your wallet is reset every time you reload.
wallet.title: Wallet Settings

confwallc.help-top: Use the options below to import an existing wallet or create a new one.
confwallc.msg-already-confd: You already have a wallet configured
confwallc.msg-backup: Before going any further, be 100% certain you have backed up the seed to your current wallet!
confwallc.msg-backup2: Without it, any funds you have will become completely unrecoverable!
confwallc.msg-backup-do: Make sure you back up your seed, write it down, and keep it incredibly safe!  There is NO way to recover it after creation, and all funds inside WILL be lost without it!  You have been warned!
confwallc.msg-configured: Your wallet has been configured and you are ready to receive and send Mikron!
confwallc.msg-import: If you already have a Mikron wallet, you can import it below.  When you import a wallet, none of your existing wallets or accounts are affected, and your seed is not stored anywhere besides in your local client.  Use the drop down below to select which type of import you want to use.
confwallc.msg-import-file: If you have saved your wallet to a file using MikronWebWallet before, use the button below to import it.
confwallc.msg-ledger-status: TIP: Press the Ledger status bar on the left side to reload your Ledger when connecting or disconnecting it.
confwallc.msg-mnemonic: Enter your wallet mnemonic phrase generated from any Mikron wallet to import it below.
confwallc.msg-new-seed: When you create a new wallet, a new seed will be generated which can be used to create brand new accounts on the Mikron network.  Your Mikron seed is the master key to all of your accounts and any money inside of them!
confwallc.msg-pwd-lose: TIP: If you forget your password, you can always restore your wallet using your seed (or menmonic).
confwallc.msg-pwd-set: The last step is to set a new password for your wallet.  Your password is used to encrypt the sensitive parts of your wallet when it is locked, which disables sending, receiving, creating accounts, and other operations.
confwallc.msg-seed: Enter your 64 character seed from any Mikron wallet to import it below.
confwallc.msg-wallet-created: Your new Mikron wallet has been created!  Below is the mnemonic phrase and seed for your wallet, you can use whichever you prefer.
confwallc.msg-write-down: Make sure to write down your mnemonic phrase/seed or save it somewhere safe, and NEVER SHARE IT with anyone!
confwallc.msg-write-down2: It is the master key to all of your accounts, and the only way to recover your funds in an emergency.
confwallc.title: Configure Wallet

ledger-service.warning-locked: Ledger device locked.  Unlock and open the Nano application.
ledger-service.warning-unable-to-connect: Unable to connect to the Ledger device.  Make sure it is unlocked and the Nano application is open.

addr.title: MikronWebWallet Address Book
addr.desc: Use this tool to simplify transferring your address book between devices.  Use the options below to import or export your address book from a file or QR Code/URL.  Your address book is not encrypted by your wallet password.
addr.msg1: Scan the QR code on any device to import your MikronWebWallet Address Book!
addr.msg2: If you do not have a QR code scanner, you can also import your address book by using the URL below.

buw.title: Backup Wallet
buw.unlock: To access backup options, unlock your wallet.
buw.mnemonic-msg1: To backup your wallet mnemonic phrase,
buw.mnemonic-msg2: to copy it to your clipboard.
buw.seed-msg2: to copy it to your clipboard.

expwal.title: Export MikronWebWallet Wallet
expwal.desc: Use this export tool to simplify wallet transfer to other devices. Your data will be encrypted by your password, and then imported into MikronWebWallet on your new device! The export does not contain your address book.
expwal.msg1: Scan the QR code on any device to load your MikronWebWallet wallet!
expwal.msg2: If you do not have a QR code scanner, you can also import your wallet by using the URL below.

node-service.error-unable-connect-node: Unable to connect to the remote Mikron node, account balances may be inaccurate!

repsc.cat1t: This is an official representative or it has very high (10%+) voting weight.  It is recommended to change to a new representative!
repsc.cat2t: This representative has a high voting weight (1%+).  Consider changing to a new representative.
repsc.cat3t: This representative is marked as trusted.  No change is needed.
repsc.cat4t: This representative is saved in your list, as long as it is online, no change is needed.
repsc.cat5t: This representative is not known, consider switching to a known one or add this one to your list
repsc.desc: You have delegated voting weight to the following representatives
repsc.no-acc-delegated: None of your accounts have delegated any voting weight yet, you must receive a transaction to change your representative!
repsc.select-accounts: Select the accounts which are using this representative
repsc.select-rep-desc: Click on a representative to select all of the accounts delegated to it
repsc.title: Representatives Overview

sendc.error-not-enough: From account does not have enough balance!
sendc.error-send: There was an error sending your transaction, please try again!
sendc.title: Send Mikron
sendc.warning-accounts-must-differ: From and to accounts must be different
sendc.warning-accounts-required: From and to accounts are required
sendc.warning-to-invalid: To account address is not valid

transdetc.title: Transaction Details
transdetc.unable-load: Unable to load the transaction, double check that the hash is correct and try again!

wallet-service.error-receive: There was a problem performing the receive transaction, try manually!
wallet-service.warn-new-incoming-unlock: New incoming transaction - unlock the wallet to receive it!

wallet-widget.lock-must-set-password: You must set a password on your wallet - it is currently blank!

welcomec.feedback-github: Please submit any feedback or bug reports on our GitHub page.
welcomec.get-started: To get started, choose an option below to configure your wallet
welcomec.oss-github: MikronWebWallet is open source and all code is available at:
welcomec.title: Welcome to the Mikron Web Wallet!
welcomec.wallet-configured: Welcome back!  It looks like your wallet is already configured.

ad.d1: All sensitive operations happen in your browser only - your seed and private keys are never sent across your network, or stored on any server in any format. (So there is no need for server-based authentication measures such as 2FA)
ad.d2: Send and receive Mikron from any device using the web wallet, be it mobile or desktop, Windows or Liunux.
ad.d3: Because no information is ever stored on a server, there is no account to login to or email address required. Create as many wallets as you want and switch between them easily.
ad.d4: Store labels for your friends and your own accounts in the address book, view any Mikron account, track your balances in your local currency, and more!

work-pool-serv.error-retrieve: Failed to retrieve work.  Try a different PoW method.
